abstract: Microsoft has held talks with the News Corporation about a tie up, which would involve News Corp. getting paid to take its news Web sites off Google, according to press reports.
snippet: Microsoft has held talks with the News Corporation about a tie up, which would involve News Corp. getting paid to take its news Web sites off Google, according to press reports.
lead_paragraph: Update | 2:03 p.m. Media Decoder provides more details of the talks between the News Corporation and Microsoft.

headline.main: Microsoft and News Corp. Said to Weigh Web Pact

abstract: The News Corporation has engaged in early discussions with Microsoft about a pact to get paid by the software maker to remove its news content from Google’s search engine.
snippet: The News Corporation has engaged in early discussions with Microsoft about a pact to get paid by the software maker to remove its news content from Google’s search engine.
lead_paragraph: From Ashlee Vance and Tim Arango at Media Decoder:

headline.main: For Search, Murdoch Eyes Deal With Microsoft
